item.title: New high school option in Far Northeast Denver! Founded upon...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

New high school option in Far Northeast Denver! Founded upon HBCU principles, the Robert F. Smith STEAM Academy honors students’ history, individuality, cultural experiences, and future potential. Current eighth graders can join the founding class: https://bit.ly/2VuOu2U

#WarriorsforHighQualitySchools #CommunityWarrior #RobertFSmithSTEAMacademy #WeAreHere

Denver School Board President, Dr. Carrie A. Olson

item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: Statement from Director Anderson on today’s domestic terrorist...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Statement from Director Anderson on today’s domestic terrorist attack in Washington D.C.

For the first time since the war of 1812 our capitol was attacked, not by a foreign enemy but by domestic terrorists.

Today we witnessed the epitome of white privilege and how the system was built to work against people of color.

...

In our darkest days we must rise.

If those individuals that stormed the capitol were Black we would’ve seen a different response from law enforcement, that is a fact. If President Barack Obama encouraged a coup, Republicans would call for his removal.

I hope today can serve as a reminder that fascism will never prevail.

Today and everyday we must proclaim that #BlackLivesMatter

Today and everyday we must call out these acts for what they are and that is domestic terrorism.

Today and everyday we must remember through our darkest days WE WILL RISE.

- Director Tay Anderson

See More
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: Soliciting feedback from educators should not be called an abuse...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Soliciting feedback from educators should not be called an abuse of power, but empowered to hear the voices of those that feel as if we are not listening to them.

I wanted to hear directly from those that wanted to engage and I heard from HUNDREDS of DPS educators connecting with them 1:1 and acknowledging I can’t change anything alone, but their voices deserved to be heard.

Here is the original email and my response:
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: It’s time to teach proper sex education and consent. After...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

It’s time to teach proper sex education and consent.

After hearing first hand stories on things that have happened to our students in Denver it’s time to tackle this head on.

DPS must be a safe and welcoming environment for ALL!
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: Climate change is real and our schools can take bold action to...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Climate change is real and our schools can take bold action to do our part to save our planet 🌎

I am going to re-introduce a resolution to tackle climate change in Denver Public Schools.
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: School dress codes are sexist. I will dedicate time over the...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

School dress codes are sexist.

I will dedicate time over the next semester working with students, educators, and community to re-evaluate school dress codes.
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: Students that menstruate have often been over looked when it...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Students that menstruate have often been over looked when it comes our public schools providing free access to basic products for their health, and that will END in 2021.

I will be bringing forth a resolution to end period poverty in Denver Public Schools.
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: Denver School Board Director - Tay AndersonDr. Martin Luther King, Jr. Early College was live.KJ, KP: DMLK's "The Take" - S2: E1: Righting...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay AndersonDr. Martin Luther King, Jr. Early College was live.

KJ, KP: DMLK's "The Take" - S2: E1: Righting History

In this episode, we will be speaking to Dr. Milton and Dr. Freeman; the authors of the BLACK History 365 Ed...ucation curriculum, and Carleen Brown, educator and Director of Media Relations for Black History 365.
BH365 is an educational entity whose purpose is to create cutting-edge resources that invite students, educators, and other readers to become critical thinkers, compassionate listeners, fact-based, respectful communicators and action-oriented solutionists.

See More
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: Elected officials should not be permitted to “jump” the line...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Elected officials should not be permitted to “jump” the line for COVID vaccinations.

I will not get the vaccine until majority of our educators in Denver Public Schools get it.
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: I’m not ashamed for choosing not to go the traditional college...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

I’m not ashamed for choosing not to go the traditional college track.

I actually believe folks should have the autonomy to decide what is best for them.

I could be graduating college with debt this year, but instead I am the youngest Black elected official in CO history.
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: Denver School Board Director - Tay AndersonDenver Public SchoolsWe apologize to the families who came out this morning and had to wait for...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay AndersonDenver Public Schools

We apologize to the families who came out this morning and had to wait for more than an hour to receive their meal boxes. This is unacceptable. We are working w...ith the food distribution vendor we partnered with to determine the cause for the delays and the issues that led to them not delivering food as promised. We know that hunger is still an issue in our community. Denver Public Schools will continue to work to ensure that families receive assistance. We will do our best to make sure that these efforts run more smoothly in the future.

See More
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: DPS Food and Nutrition Services and Revolution Foods are...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

DPS Food and Nutrition Services and Revolution Foods are providing 7-day box meals that will be available for pickup on Dec. 22 and Dec. 29 at the locations below.

10:30 a.m.–12 p.m.
Barnum Elementary
Bruce Randolph...
Evie Dennis Campus
Kepner Campus
College View Elementary

12:30 p.m.–2 p.m.
Cowell Elementary
Montbello Campus
Dr. Martin Luther King
Munroe Elementary
Joe Shoemaker

Boxes are only available for kids 18 years and younger. Box distribution will be during publicized hours or until all boxes are distributed.

Regular food distribution and delivery sites are closed Dec. 21–Jan. 1 and resume Jan. 4.

item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: As we celebrate the birth of Jesus Christ, let us remember he...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

As we celebrate the birth of Jesus Christ, let us remember he was homeless and undocumented.

So I expect everyone, especially those on the right side of the aisle to treat our neighbors like they would treat Jesus.

Merry Christmas
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Enjoy the next few minutes of my colleagues Jennifer Bacon and Scott Baldermann close out our final board meeting of 2020 with some HEAT!
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: Today our community has lost a true champion for justice. Mrs....
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Today our community has lost a true champion for justice.

Mrs. Earleen Brown was an advocate for education in the Denver community and was my number one supporter. In 2017 she rode around Denver in what we called the “Tay-mobile.”

She stood with me again as I sought the At-Large seat in 2020, but she was more than a supporter she was an additional grandma. She would randomly call and check in on me, she would always hold my feet to the fire to ensure I was serving my commun...ity, and she would be the first one to help pick me up when life would knock me down.

Mrs. Earleen will be forever missed and I am committing to fight so her legacy is remembered in Denver Public Schools.

See More
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: Yesterday outgoing DPS Superintendent Susana Cordova sat down...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Yesterday outgoing DPS Superintendent Susana Cordova sat down with Anne Trujillo and said that she never felt mistreated nor was she in a hostile work environment.

I am now calling on Mayor Hancock, Mayor Peña, and the 14 former SB Directors to retract their statements.
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: I would like to wish all of our families that celebrate Hanukkah...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

I would like to wish all of our families that celebrate Hanukkah a very Happy Hanukkah.

I'm excited to celebrate our diverse faiths and backgrounds and to show our students that we as a community value each and every one of them.
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: *** Social Media Policy *** Guidelines for functioning in an...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

*** Social Media Policy ***

Guidelines for functioning in an electronic world are the same as the values, ethics and respectability policies expected to live every day. You can expect discussions on many topics and many viewpoints in my posts. You can also expect the following:

*Engagement in healthy, open and honest dialogues

...

*Welcoming of constructive criticism

*Corrections of inaccurate or misleading postings

*Deletion of posts that are spam, inappropriate, defamatory, use profanity, and/or otherwise offensive

*An understanding that respect goes both ways — I will use good judgment in my posts and respond to you in a respectful manner. In return, I ask the same of you. (If instances of bullying and/or harassment take place, I may unfriend, block and or report the matter to Facebook, depending on the seriousness of the situation.)

*Honoring of our differences — I will not tolerate discrimination (including age, sex, race, color, creed, religion, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, disability, or marital status or any other legally recognized protected basis under federal, state, or local laws, regulations or ordinances).

For further questions on this policy please email me at Tay_Anderson@dpsk12.org

See More
item.author: Tay Anderson
